intro: Landolphia exilis, commonly known as the slender African morning glory, is a climbing vine native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Convulvulaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, hard seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in some regions.
